title: Republic of Bean Refugee Crisis
description: A significant influx of refugees from neighboring Orangenya has created educational challenges in the Republic of Bean. As a parliamentary member, you must allocate limited resources to create an effective education policy that balances integration needs with budget constraints.

access_opt1.modifiedDescription: Limited access may worsen social tensions in a nation already dealing with minority issues.

access_opt2.modifiedDescription: Separate schools are politically popular with Grapes majority but reinforces existing cultural divides.

access_opt3.modifiedDescription: Full integration could help address the Republic's existing cultural tensions while supporting refugees.

lang_opt1.modifiedDescription: Teanish-only policies already disenfranchise the Curly Hairs minority and would further marginalize refugees.

lang_opt2.modifiedDescription: Basic language courses provide essential communication while respecting the Republic's linguistic traditions.

lang_opt3.modifiedDescription: Bilingual education would benefit both refugees and existing minorities, but may face resistance from Grapes majority.

teacher_opt1.modifiedDescription: Minimal training leaves teachers unprepared to handle the complex needs of refugee students.

teacher_opt2.modifiedDescription: Basic training helps teachers manage cultural differences but may not address deeper trauma issues.

teacher_opt3.modifiedDescription: Comprehensive training equips teachers to address both educational and psychosocial needs of refugee students.

curr_opt1.modifiedDescription: Standard curriculum already excludes Curly Hairs perspectives and would further alienate refugee students.

curr_opt2.modifiedDescription: Supplementary materials provide recognition without challenging the core curriculum.

curr_opt3.modifiedDescription: Inclusive curriculum could address longstanding cultural tensions while supporting new refugee populations.

psych_opt1.modifiedDescription: Minimal support leaves refugees from conflict-torn Orangenya vulnerable to ongoing trauma.

psych_opt2.modifiedDescription: Basic counseling addresses immediate needs but may not resolve deeper trauma issues.

psych_opt3.modifiedDescription: Comprehensive support is particularly crucial given the recent conflicts in Orangenya.

fin_opt1.modifiedDescription: Minimal funding is especially problematic given the Republic's current economic instability.

fin_opt2.modifiedDescription: Moderate funding balances fiscal constraints with refugee needs in a challenging economic climate.

fin_opt3.modifiedDescription: Comprehensive funding requires significant resources during a period of economic instability.

cert_opt1.modifiedDescription: Local recognition only prevents refugees from utilizing valuable skills and knowledge from their home country.

cert_opt2.modifiedDescription: Universal standards help refugees integrate into the workforce and continue their education.

cert_opt3.modifiedDescription: Tailored programs maximize the potential contributions of refugees to the Republic's society and economy.
